thread.title: Double stabbing in Harringay leaves two men fighting for their lives in hospital
thread.title_full: Double stabbing in Harringay leaves two men fighting for their lives in hospital

author: Chloe Chaplain
title: Double stabbing in Harringay leaves two men fighting for their lives in hospital
text:
Sunday 5 February 2017 00:10 BST Click to follow Stabbing: Police and paramedics rushed to the scene on Green Lanes 
Two men have been left fighting for their lives after a double stabbing in Harringay. 
Police were called to reports of a stabbing outside a Turkish restaurant opposite Harringay Green Lanes Overground station. 
Two men - aged 26 and 29 - were rushed to hospital with life threatening injuries. 
Traffic on Green Lanes was brought to a halt as ambulances and police cars rushed to the scene outside Rakkas shish bar. Police cordon: The road was taped off outside the restaurant 
The road was cordoned off at around 10.45pm as officers scoured the scene but the suspects fled before police arrived. 
An eyewitness, who did not want to be named, told The Standard: “We were in the restaurant and two men came in and started looking around. 
“No one thought anything of it but then suddenly there were loads of police outside and we all had to leave.” 
The eyewitness said he believed the stabbing had taken place outside the restaurant. Police cordon: The suspects fled before officers arrived 
A police statement said: "Police were called on Saturday, 4 February at 10:45pm to Green Lanes to reports of a stabbing. 
"Officers attended along with the London Ambulance Service and found two men suffering from stab injuries. 
"The men - aged 26 and 29 - were taken by LAS to an east London hospital. Their injuries at this initial stage are being treated as life threatening. 
"The suspects made off prior to police arrival. No arrests have been made. 
"Officers remain on scene and there is currently a cordon in place." 
Any witnesses or anyone with information should contact police in Haringey on 101 or call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111. More about:
